summary.seg: This devotional manuscript is a composite volume that consists of two parts. Although both parts were produced separately from one and another, it is likely that the second part was copied with a view to complement the first part.

The manuscript's first part (ff. 3r-145v) begins with a collection of catechetical teachings in Middle English prose (ff. 3r-18v) and is followed by a large collection of devotional instructions and prayers in Middle English and Latin prose and verse (ff. 19r-143r). This part was copied by seven scribes. While Margaret Connolly (2009) dates the manuscript broadly to the 15th century, Ann Eljenholm Nichols (2014) dates it to c. 1425.

The manuscript's second part (ff. 146r-157v) contains prayers and protective amulets in English and Latin and medical recipes in English. The texts were copied by two scribes probably in the late 15th or early 16th century.

The first part contains a unique Middle English visionary account about a nun from Hampole Priory, West Yorkshire, who is visited by the soul of her brother, a knight who had died after he had been mortally wounded in the Battle of Shrewsbury in 1403 (ff. 80v-81v). In the vision, her brother gives her a letter on which are written six psalms and prayers with which she can save him from Purgatory if she performs them for his soul for twenty consecutive days. Although scholars have previously considered this work an authentic text from Hampole Priory (see Harley (1989) and Connolly (2010)), near-identical 15th-century texts in Middle Dutch and Middle German prayer books suggest that it is a translation of a Continental exemplum instead. Since none of the Continental versions situate the events of the vision at Hampole Priory or even in England, it appears that the English translator reworked the narrative specifically to promote the nunnery’s intercessory prayers among potential lay benefactors (Drieshen (2022)).

Dr Clarck Drieshen
Project Cataloguer
Cambridge University Library

foliation.note: Numbering in pencil in the upper right-hand corner of the rectos, including the later addition of '128 bis' for a leaf that had been missed from this foliation. This foliation sequence is followed in this record.
Numbering in pencil in the lower right-hand corner of the rectos, regularly interpersed by leaves with no folio numbers written on them.

collation.formula: 1-38 48+1 (1st added) 5-78 88-1 (5th cancelled) 98-1 (5th cancelled) 108-1 (5th cancelled) 118-1 (5th cancelled) 128 138-1 (5th cancelled) 148-1 (5th cancelled) 15-188 196-1 (6th cancelled) | 206 216-2 (3rd and 4th cancelled) 226-1 (1st cancelled)
collation.note: This collation deviates from the collations by H.L. Pink and M.R. James (unpublished descriptions) who consider Quire 4 a quinternion with one leaf (the 10th leaf, according to Pink) cancelled. However, the fact that Quire 4's second leaf features the signature 1d, suggests that the quire is a quaternion with an added leaf at the beginning.

note.p: Notes in a 17th-century hand on f. 159v and f. 160v may pertain to cancelled leaves in the manuscript: sed [...] 64 may refer to the cancelled leaf before f. 64.
Collation formula by the hand of H.L. Pink, on the inside of the inside of the rear cover.

binding.p: Brown leather over wooden boards with five raised bands on the spine, athe gold-stamped title Devotiones and classmark Ii.6.43. This binding was made by W.H. Smith and Son, Ltd., at London in November 1958 (see the inscription on the inside of the front cover).
There are marks of what may have been a chain staple attached to a previous binding on the lower edges of ff. i-2.

provenance.p: Sir Thomas Knyvett (1539-1618) Knyvett, Thomas Sir, 1539-1618: Knyvett's shelfmark is inscribed on f. 159v (with off-set on f. 160v): Sed. 64. Not identified in McKitterick (1978), p. 164 (MS 64).
Thomas Knyvett (1596-1658) Knyvett, Thomas, 1596-1658: grandson of Sir Thomas Knyvett 1539-1618, inherited this manuscript together with Knyvett's collection. See McKitterick (1978), pp. 33-34..

John Knyvett (1623-1673) Knyvett, John, 1623-1673: great-grandson of Sir Thomas Knyvett 1539-1618 and son of Thomas Knyvett (1596-1658), inherited this manuscript together with Knyvett's collection. See McKitterick (1978), p. 36 .

Thomas Knyvett (d. 1693) Knyvett, Thomas, d. 1693: great-great-grandson of Sir Thomas Knyvett 1539-1618 and son of John Knyvett (1623-1673), inherited this manuscript together with Knyvett's collection. Thomas died without heir and the Knyvett library was fragmented after his death: 57 of Knyvett's manuscripts had been acquired by John Moore [see below] by 1698. See McKitterick (1978), p. 37.
John Moore (1646-1714), bishop of Ely Moore, John, 1646-1714 : no. 199 (also inscribed in the manuscript on f. 1r and f. 2v) in Bernard, Catalogi librorum manuscriptorum Angliæ et Hiberniæ (c. 1697).

history.acquisition: Presented to the University Library in 1715 by George I George I, King of Great Britain, 1660-1727 : donation bookplate engraved by John Pine Pine, John, 1690-1756 in 1736 on the inside of the front cover (previously, this bookplate may have been pasted on f. 159v, which contains the remains of glue and paper).

recordHist.source: This catalogue entry draws on on Margaret Connolly, Manuscripts in the University Library, Cambridge (Dd-Oo), The Index of Middle English Prose, 17 (Cambridge: Brewer, 2009); an unpublished description of the manuscript composed between 1926 and 1930 by M.R. James James, M.R. (Montague Rhodes), 1862-1936, now held in the University Archives (UA ULIB 7/3/74); and an unpublished description of the manuscript composed between 1948 and 1970 by H.L. Pink Pink, H. L., now held in the University Archives (UA ULIB 7/3/75).

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card. For information on eligibility and admissions procedures, see Joining the Library). For further information on the availability of the manuscript, please contact the Manuscripts Reading Room.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, University Library, MS Ii.6.43, ff. 3r-145v

msContents.textLang: Latin and Middle English with linguistic features locatable to the Southeast Midland; see Nichols (2014)

msItem.title: Instruction for magic use of herbs
msItem.incipit: 1r [...] for loue of a woman take Erbis flowe [?william] and barre it upon ye / Galandina for leve / Spynactla for daungar of wekyd men fier and water / vrina for a kyt or a sore

msItem.title: Commentary on the Ten Commanmdents
msItem.rubric: 3r Here beygynnen þe ten commaundementys of almyȝty god wyche he comaundid vs to kepe vp on peyne of euerlastynge dampnacioun
msItem.incipit: 3r [Þ]e fyrst comaundement of almyȝty god is þys þe lord god spake all þese wordys I am þe lord þy god þat lad þee oute of þe lond of egipte oute of þe hous of þraldom þou shalt not haue to fere me no strange goddys þou shalt not make to þe an ymage grauen ne no similitude of þynge þat is in heuen aboue
msItem.explicit: 9v lust of flesshe pride of lyf and þese þre synnes enwalpen all oþer synnes þat ony man dooþ

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 237

msItem.title: Pride, Envy and Wrath [Extract from the Speculum Ecclesie, Chapter 8]
msItem.author: Edmund of Abingdon
msItem.incipit: 9v [P]ryde enuy wraþ slouþ couetyse glotonye and leccherye. Pryde is a loue of mannys owne heynes and þer of comen all þese senne
msItem.explicit: 11v himself slouþe turneþ him couetise casteþ him awey glotonye disseiueþ him leccherye putteþ him into seruage

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 237

msItem.title: The Seven Bodily Works of Mercy [Extract from The Mirror of St Edmund or Speculum Ecclesie, Chapter 16]
msItem.author: Edmund of Abingdon
msItem.rubric: 11v Here beginnne þe seuen werkis of bodely mercy
msItem.incipit: 11v [F]ede þe hongry and not þo þat han no nede to þy mete
msItem.explicit: 12r bery ded men but principali þe þat semeden to þy knowynge louerys and keperis of goddes lawe

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 238

msItem.title: The Seven Spiritual Works of Mercy
msItem.rubric: 12r Here begynnen þe seuen werkis of gostely mercy
msItem.incipit: 12r [T]eche þou gladly þe good þat þu canst
msItem.explicit: 12r prey for all men as for frendes so and for enemys

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 238

msItem.title: The Seven Gifts of the Holy Spirit
msItem.rubric: [Here] begennen þe seuen ȝyftis of þe holy gost
msItem.incipit: 12v [W]ysdom þat is be gostely wys in sauynge þy soule vndirstondinge þat is gostely vndirstondinge þe lawe of our god Consell þat is ȝeue god consell and take god consell
msItem.explicit: 12v And drede of þe lord god in any þynge

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 238

msItem.title: The Seven Principal Virtues
msItem.rubric: 12v Here begynnen þe seuen blissed virtuis þat cristes spouse . þat is manis soule shulde be honoured whit
msItem.incipit: 13r [T]emperaunce or mesure þat is mesure so þysylf in etynge drinkinge slepinge wakynge worchinge restyn spekinge styll beynge and so forþe of oþer þynge to kepe þy soule to þe plesaunt of god prudence
msItem.explicit: 13r Cherite þat is loue god aboue all þyngys and þy neyȝbore as þy sylf

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 239

msItem.title: The Five Bodily Wits
msItem.rubric: 13r Here begynnyn þe fyue bodely wittis
msItem.incipit: 13v [H]erynge þat is here þu gladly þe lawe of god and al maner of godnes and treuþe and uoide fro þyn heringe all maner of ribaudrye wykked and fals wordys
msItem.explicit: 13v uoyde fro þy touchinge all vnleffull [crossed out: þynge] craftis or werkis be þey neuer so gret wynnynge or lekynge

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 239

msItem.title: The Five Spiritual Wits
msItem.rubric: 14r Here begynne þe fyue gostely wittis
msItem.incipit: 14r [W]ylle mynde vndirstondinge ymaginacioun and resoun wyl þou þat þe wyl of god be ffulfyld byfore þyn owen wylle
msItem.explicit: 14r Resonabli rewle þy selfe vndyr þe forme of goddes lawe and all þo þat ben vndir þe .Jhesus. Amen

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 239

msItem.title: The Sixteen Conditions of Charity
msItem.rubric: 14r Here begynneþ þe fyftene condicionis of cherite
msItem.incipit: 14v [Y]f y speke with tongys of men and of angelys and y haue not cherite y am mad as bras sowninge or as a simball tynkinge and yf y haue profecie and know all misteryes and all kunnynge and yf y haue all feyþe so þat y moue hyllys from her place and haue not cherite I am nouȝt
msItem.explicit: 15r and yf a man knew no more of þe lawe of god but þese .xvj condicions and besied him to kepe hem he myȝt lyȝtly come to heuen and wete who wente amys

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 239

msItem.title: Explanation of the beatitudes of All Saints' Day
msItem.rubric: 15r Thys is þe gospell of allhalewen day
msItem.incipit: 15r-15v [A]nd iesu seiinge þe peple went vp in to an hil and wrhanne [sic] he was set his dissiplis cam to him and he opned his mouþ and tauȝt hem and seyd blessed be pore men in spirit for þe kyndoum of heuen is herys
msItem.explicit: 16r for þe mede is plenteous in heuenys for so þey han pursued also prophetis þat weren before yow

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 240

msItem.title: Exposition on the Pater Noster [Extract from the Speculum Ecclesie, Chapter 17]
msItem.author: Edmund of Abingdon
msItem.rubric: 16r Seynt edmunde techeþ us here a schorte exposicioun of oure pater noster
msItem.incipit: 16r [T]hu shalt vndyrstonde þat þo þat come bifore þat is to sey pater noster qui es in celis techen vs how we shull pray and weche we shull be in praynge for we mote haue iiij þyngys in euery preyer
msItem.explicit: 18v for yf þy body be in þe quere þy lippis in sauter þyn herte in strete or market wrecchidly þan arte þou departed. [A]men

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 240

msItem.title: Directions on how to meditate on Christ's passion
msItem.textLang: Middle English instructions with Latin prayers
msItem.incipit: 19r [Ȝ]yf þu be in dedly synne or in anguysshe go to þe chyrche and knele afore þe rode and pray god þat he haue mercy on þe and þat he graunte þe þy prayer as soþely as he graunted paradys to þe thef when he hynge vp on þe cros
msItem.explicit: 19v-20r [A]nd wete þou well forsoþe þat þy prayer shall be herde forþe

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 368

msItem.title: Mark 16:17-18
msItem.incipit: 20r [S]igna autem eos qui crediderunt hec sequentur in nomine meo demonia eicient linguis loquerentur vo serpentes tollent et si mortiferum quid biberunt non eis nocebit super egros manus imponent et bene habebunt

msItem.title: Verse prayer to the Trinity
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric with Middle English prayer
msItem.incipit: 20r [A]llmyȝtty god fadyr of heuen / for cristes sone þat dyde on rode / y prey þe lord to here my steuen
msItem.explicit: 20v Almyȝtty god of mercy most / lord ihesu haue mercy on me
msItem.note: This prayer also occurs on ff. 99v-100r.

msItem.title: Amulet based on the measurement of the length of the body of Christ with prayers to Sts Cyricus and Jullita
msItem.textLang: Middle English rubric with Latin prayer
msItem.rubric: 20v-21v Thys lyf [sic: 'lyn'] aboue fyftene tymys meten is þe lengþe of oure lord iesu and what day þou lokest þeron and blesse þe þere with in þe name of god and of his lengþe man ne deuyll shall þe not greue and þow þou be in dedly synne þou shalt not be acombered þerwiþ in wakynge slepynge by day ne by nyȝt. Ne þorow wynde ne. water ne wykked gost ne fyre ne seytenynge ne þundir ne tempest in see ne in lond for þu shalt not be greued ne þu shalt not be scomfited in batell ne no soden deeþ haue ne no myscheficous deeþ haue ne no maner of feuir haue hote ne kolde þat þe shall greue and þu shalt ouer come þyne enemys for god and seynt . Cerice and seynt Julit is moþer of all poysonis shullen desyuer þe quite and encrese þy wordely god and breke þyn enemys pouer and yf a woman trauase with chylde sche shall be delyuered with outyn peryll and þe chyld shall haue Alpha et oomega [sic] and þe woman purified
msItem.incipit: 21v [S]alue decus paruulorum miles regis angelorum O sancte martir Cirice qui beata genitrice tue Julitta Christum nunc ex ora nos saluet \mortis/ in ora [sic: hora]
msItem.explicit: 21v-22r et per potencias tuas et per virtutes et intercessionem sanctorum tuorum Cirice Julitee triumphum omnium inimicorum meorum possum retinere constanciam per Christum dominum nostrum. Amen.
msItem.note: Full transcription; the measure that represents the length of the Cross of Christ at a 1:15 scale is not present in the manuscript but other copies of this amulet in manuscripts and on rolls are typically accompanied by a drawing of a Tau cross.

msItem.title: Prayers on Christ's wounds and Mary's suffering at the passion
msItem.incipit: 22r O myȝtfull iesu gret was þe payne þat ȝe sofered when ȝe were crowned wiþ scharpe prykkynge þornis wiþ stauys hit was smete a doun on your heed þat þe poyntes perishid nere vnto your brayne þe blood ran be your face now good lord for þat payne yf hit be your wylle forȝeue me all þat y haue offended yow from my begynnynge in to þys tyme
msItem.explicit: 25r-25v comforte vs all in oure nede bodely and gostely and specially hem þat prai for me and truste to my preyer [P]ater noster [a]ue maria
msItem.note: The prayer is divided into twelve section, each ending with a Pater Noster sometimes with an Ave Maria

msItem.title: Indulgenced prayer to Christ for the Elevation
msItem.rubric: 26r [Q]uicumque dixerit hanc oracionem subsequentem Inter eleuacionem corporis Christi et tercium agnus dei duo milia annorum indulgencie conceduntur per papam Bonefacium sextum ad supplicacionem philippi regis francie
msItem.incipit: 26r [D]omine ihesu Christe qui hanc sacratissimam carnem de gloriose virginis vtero assumpsisti et preciosum sanguinem tuum de sanctissimo latere tuo in ara crucis pro salute nostra effundisti
msItem.explicit: 26v et ab vniversis malis peccatis et periculis preteritis presentibus atque futuris Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer of St Edmund to St John the Evangelist against sudden death and temptation
msItem.rubric: 26v [S]anctus edmundus composuit istam oracionem pro morte subitanea et pro temptacione diaboli
msItem.incipit: 26v [O] beate Johannes apostole et euangelista qui virgo est electus atque inter ceteros magis dilectus
msItem.explicit: 27r Qui est honor et gloria in secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: Indulgenced prayer to the Passion
msItem.rubric: 27r [O]mnibus vere contritis et confessis istam oracionem subsequentem cum antiphona dicentibus pro qualibet vice sex milia septuagi[n]ta anni de indulgencia conseduntur [a]
msItem.incipit: 27r [C]rucis corone spinee clauis que dire lancie honorem impendamus
msItem.explicit: 27v [C]oncede quaesumus omnipotens deus vt qui sacratissime redempcionis nostre insignia temporaliter veneramur per hec indesinenter minuti eternitatis gloriam consequamur. Per Dominum

msItem.title: Indulgenced prayer to the Holy Face
msItem.rubric: 27v [Q]uicumque hanc oracionem deuoto dixerit autoritate sancti petri pape primi et aliorum .x.x.x.a summorum pontificum ex parte cuiuslibet predictorum xla dies indulgencie habebit. Antiphona
msItem.incipit: 27v [S]alue sancta facies nostri saluatoris in qua nitet species diuini splendoris
msItem.explicit: 28v [D]eus qui signatis lumen vultus tui memoriale tuum ad instanciam veronice ymaginem tuam sudario impressam relinquere voluisti per passionem tuam et crucem nobis tribue vt ita nunc in terris per speculum in enigmate ipsam venerari honorare amare laudare que valeamus vt ita te iudicem supernos venientem faciem ad faciem videamus per te ihesu Christe saluator mundi qui viuis et regnas deus per omnia secula

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: 28v [O] maria plasma nati quem vidisti natum pati
msItem.explicit: 29r [N]e in fine condempnetur set per penas emendetur que carni apparuit

msItem.title: Suffrage to St George
msItem.rubric: 29r [O]racio deuota de sancto georgio in prosa
msItem.incipit: 29r [S]alue miles nobilis georgij messie
msItem.explicit: 29v [D]uc nos ad celestia lumine trinitatis. Amen

msItem.title: Suffrage to St Appollonia
msItem.incipit: 29v [V]irgo Christi egregia pro nobis appollonia funde preces ad dominum ne pro reatu criminum vexemur morbo dencium
msItem.explicit: 30r et post huius seculi omnes nostras ad vitam eternam perducas per Christum dominum nostrum. Amen

msItem.title: Suffrage to St Leonard
msItem.incipit: 30r [A]ue pater deo digne [A]ue dulcis et benigne [A}ue leonardi scandens polum
msItem.explicit: 30v [P]reces nostras quaesumus domino celesti dono prosequere vt qui beati leonardi confessoris tui atque abbatis patrociniis gloriamur eius meritis atque suffragiis et intercessionibus ab omnibus malis liberemur per Christum dominum nostrum. Amen.

msItem.title: Indulgenced prayer for the souls of the dead
msItem.rubric: 30v [D]ominus papa Innocencius quartus concessit omnibus hanc oracionem in cimiterio vel in ecclesia pro animabus deuote dicentibus pro quolibet defuncto ibi requiescente quadraginta dies indulgencie et tresdecim quadragenas
msItem.incipit: 30v [A]uete fideles omnes anime in sancta pace requiescentes qui vos redeunt suo preciose sanguine vobis dignetur misereri penas vestras minuere anime que sepulta et anime omnium fidelium defunctorum per dei misericordiam requiescant in perpetua pace. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for the souls of the dead
msItem.incipit: 30v [M]iserere domine per gloriosam resureccionem tuam animabus omnium fidelium defunctorum
msItem.explicit: 30v-31v et libera eas de intollerabilibus penis en angustus inferni et perduceas ad societatem ciuium supernorum propter nomen sanctum tuum ihesus Amen

msItem.title: Prayer attributed to St Francis
msItem.textLang: Middle English rubric with Latin prayer
msItem.rubric: 31v [W]ho so seyeþ þis orisoun of worþely godis schall him fayle none and of his synnis he schall haue remissioun and aftir his ende he schall to þe blisse of heuen come for oure lord ihesu criste sende it by an aungill to seynt ffraunceys . And euermore aftir he vsed þe same
msItem.incipit: 31v [S]aluator mundi saluum me fac domine ihesu
msItem.explicit: 32r et consciencia amor et desiderium vite eterne et perseuerancia in bone vsque in finem Prestante domino nostro ihesu Christo Qui cum patre et fillio et spiritu sancto viuis et [crossed out: 'rg'] regnas deus

msItem.title: Suffrage to St Patrick
msItem.incipit: 32r [D]omine presul egregie pastor gregis hibernie o patrici presul pie nostri custos familie funde preces cotidie pro nobis regi glorie Versiculus: Ora pro nobis beate patrici vt digni efficiamur promissionibus cristi
msItem.explicit: 32v [O]mnipotens spmpiterne deo qui beatum patricium hiberniencium eligisti apostolum presta quaesumus vt cuius doctrina fidem sumpsimus eius apud te intercessionibus adiuvemur Per Christum dominum nostrum Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for protection attributed to St Augustine of Hippo
msItem.textLang: Middle English rubric with Latin prayer
msItem.rubric: 32v [T]his orisoun made seynt austyn þe same day þat he dyed and hoo so euer say hit þat day he schall not be brente with fyre nor perischid with water and he schall not dye nooun euill deeþ and þat day þat he seyeþ it he schall haue warnynge afore of his deeþ
msItem.incipit: 32v-33r [D]omine deus omnipotens pater et filius et spiritus sanctus Da mihi .N. famulo tuo victoria contra inimicos meos vt non possunt mihi resistere nec contradicere sed dirigatur virtus et consilium eorum in bonum
msItem.explicit: 33v Ita per hec verba libera me N famulum tuum ab omni opere [crossed out: 'moli'] malo presenti et futuro domine Amen In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti. Amen [P]ater noster [A]ue maria et [C]redo

msItem.title: Oratio ad Christum cum mens vult eius amore fervere [Oratio XX]
msItem.author: Anselm of Canterbury
msItem.rubric: 33v-34r [O]raciones siue meditaciones ab Anselmo archiepiscopo Cantuariense Que subscripte sunt que adexertandam legentis mentem ad dei amorem uel timorem . seu ad suimet discussionem edite sunt in tumultu sed inquiete nec velociter. Sed paulatim cum intenta et morosa medicacione nec debet intendere lector in qualibet earum totam perlegat. sed quantum sentit sibi deo adiuuante valere ad accendendum effectum orandi uel quantum illum delectat Nec necesse habet aliquod semper a principio incipere Sed vbi illi magis placuerit. Ad hoc enim ipsum paragraphis sunt distince per partes; vt ubi elegerit incipiat aut definit ne prolixitas aut frequens eiusdem loci repeticio generet fastidum sed pocius aliquem me colligat lecotr propter quod facte sunt pietatis affectum. Oracio a Patrem valde bona.
msItem.incipit: 34v [D]omine ihesus Christe redempcio mea. misericordia mea. Salus mea
msItem.explicit: 38v Nec tardabis quia pius est. Ipsi gloria in secula seculorum
msItem.note: For another copy of Oratio XX, see ff. 60v-61v.

msItem.title: Prayer after Matins
msItem.incipit: 39r [G]racias tibi agimus omnipotens deus sempiterne deus qui nos de transtacto [sic: transacto] noctis spacio ad matutinas horas
msItem.explicit: 39r vt donet nobis diem hunc sine impedimento Sathane transire quatinus ad uesperam et semper tibi deo gracias refero per Christum dominum nostrum. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer before Mass
msItem.incipit: 39r [O]mnipotens sempiterne deus et misericors ecce accedo ad sacramentum vnigenitum filij tui domini ihesu Christi accedo inquam infirmus ad medicum vite
msItem.explicit: 39v-40r hoc sacramentum cor[p]us tuum dulcedo anime mee salus et pax et gaudium in omni tribulacione lumen et virtus [...] in omni verbo \et/ opere secura defensio contra occurentem leonem [? quaerentem] quem deuorat in morte Qui viuis [sic]

msItem.title: Morning prayer with hymns and a collect
msItem.rubric: 40r Quando surgis in mane silicet in principio diei dicitur iste deuociones ordinem
msItem.incipit: 40r [I]n nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti. Amen. Dignare domine die isto sine peccato nos custodire per cunctis hoc signum etcaetera
msItem.explicit: 40v Domine sancte pater omnipotens eterne deus qui nos ad principium huius diei peruenire fecisti tua nos hodie salua virtute et concede ut in hanc die ad nullum declinemus mortale peccatum nec vllum incurramus periculum sed semper ad tuam iusticiam faciendam omnis nostra accio tuo moderamine dirigatur per dominum nostrum ihesum

msItem.title: Prayer after Mass
msItem.incipit: 41r [G]racias tibi ago domine pater eterne deus qui me peccatorem dignatus es corpore et sanguine domini nostri ihesu Christi filij tui comunicare
msItem.explicit: 41v Et precor vt idem ineffabile conuiuium me peccatorem perducere digneris vbi tu ipse es cum sanctis tuis . lux verba . iocunditas per sanctam gaudium sempiternum satietas securitas plena . Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary after Mass
msItem.incipit: 41v [S]anctissima virgo et inclita mater domini nostri ihesu Christi genitrix .maria. regina mundi
msItem.explicit: 41v-42r vt quicquid ineffabili sacrificio ignoranter necligenter siue accidentaliter omisi vel admisi; tuis sanctissimis precibus dignetur indulgere. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: 42r [A]ue et gaude virgo Maria mater domini nostri ihesu Christi regina celi domina mundi gloria paradisi imperatrix inferni miserere mei peccatoris et tocius populi Christiani per Christum dominum nostrum. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: 42r [B]eata es maria quae dominum portasti creatorem mundi
msItem.explicit: 42v Et bone ihesu genitricis amore nos ab eterno defende dolore. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to God the Father
msItem.incipit: 42v [D]omine sancte pater omnipotens eterne deus in illa sancta custodia in qua commendasti spiritum gloriosissimi filij tui domini nostri ihesu Christi
msItem.explicit: 43v vt non possint nocere inimici nostri visibiles et invisibiles nec corporibus nec animabus nec vigilando nec dormiendo per se nec per alium et semper misericordia tua perueniat et sequatur. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to Christ
msItem.incipit: 44r [D]omine exaudi oracionem meam et clamor meus ad te veniat
msItem.explicit: 45r-45v Indulgeat mihi dominus omnia peccata mea hic et in futuro seculo. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to Christ
msItem.incipit: 45v [O] bone ihesu . O pijssime ihesu . O dulcissime ihesu
msItem.explicit: 46v et ad tuum celeste regnum graciose peruenire atque in te per dilectissimo tunc totaliter gloriari inter omnes qui diligunt sanctissimum nomen tuum quod est ihesus. Amen. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayers to the Holy Name
msItem.incipit: 48r [A]ue ihesu criste qui pendens in cruce pro nobis peccatoribus dixisti patri tuo
msItem.explicit: 48r vt me facias finem meum feliciter consummare et ad te sum offendiculo peruenire. Qui cum deo patre et spiritu sancto viuis et regnas deus per omnia secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to St John the Evangelist
msItem.incipit: 48r [O] sancte Johannes [crossed out: 'euang'] apostole et euaungelista qui es virgo electus a domino
msItem.explicit: 48v et manifesta confessione in desiderio videndi gloriosam faciem domini nostri ihesu Christi. Qui viuit et regnat [crossed out: 'deus'] cum deo patre et spiritu sancto in vnitate perfecta in secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: Suffrage to St George
msItem.incipit: 48v [G]eorgi dei martir inclite te decet laus et gloria. Predotatum milicie
msItem.explicit: 49r [O]mnipotens sempiterne deus qui deprecancium voces benigne exaudis maiestatem tuam suppliciter exoramus vt sicut in honore beati et gloriosi martiris tui Georgij draconem a puella superari voluisti et ita eiusdem intercessione hostes nostros visibiles et invisiblies ne nocere nobis valeant concedere digneris. Per dominum nostrum ihesum Christum filium tuum

msItem.title: Prayer to the Sacred Head
msItem.incipit: 49r [D]omine ihesu Christe qui caput gloriosum angelis et hominibus venerandum spinea corona de honestari voluisti vt sanguis efflueret in redempcione mundi indulge mihi quicquid sensibus capitis deliqui. Amen. Pater noster. Aue [Maria].

msItem.title: Prayer to the wound in Christ's right hand
msItem.incipit: 49v [D]omine ihesu Christe qui manum dexteram clauo perforari voluisti vt sanguis efflueret in redempcione mundi; indulge mihi quidquid per tacum illicitum et per illicitam operacionem deliqui. Pater noster. Aue Maria.

msItem.title: Prayer to the wound in Christ's left hand
msItem.incipit: 49v [D[omine iehsu Christe qui manum sinistram clauo perforari voluisti vt sanguis efflueret in redempcione mundi; indulge mihi in quidquid per tactum illicitum et per illicitam operacionem deliqui. Pater Noster. Aue Maria.

msItem.title: Prayer to the wound in Christ's right hand
msItem.incipit: 50r [D]omine ihesu Christe qui pedem dexterum clauo perforari voluisti vt sanguis efflueret in redempcione mundi; indulge mihi quidquid per [crossed out: 'incens'] incessum deliqui. Pater [noster]. Aue [Maria].

msItem.title: Prayer to the wound in Christ's left hand
msItem.incipit: 50r [D]omine ihesu Christe qui pedem sinistrum clauo perforari voluisti vt sanguis efflueret in redempcione mundi; indulge mihi quidquid per incessum deliqui. Pater noster. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the side wound
msItem.incipit: 50r [A]ue ihesu Christe qui latus dexterum lancea militis perforari voluisti vt sanguis et vnda effluerent in redempcione mundi
msItem.explicit: 50v vt hostes omni bonorum confusi discedant. Pater noster. Aue Maria.

msItem.title: Prayer for the body of Christ [Eucharistic prayer]
msItem.incipit: 50v [D]omine ihesu Christe qui corpus tuum in cruce extendi voluisti vt omnia ossa dinumerari possent
msItem.explicit: 50v Domine ihesu Christe quidquid per officium membrorum male deliqui. Pater. Pater Noster. Aue Maria.

msItem.title: Prayer for the Elevation
msItem.incipit: 51r [A]ve verum corus preciosum verus sanguis preciosus vera redempcio salus nostra
msItem.explicit: 51r commendo corpus et animam meam omnesque sensus meos . omnesque cogitaciones . locuciones et acciones meas et totam vitam meam et finem meam et omnes necessitates et infirmitates anime et corporis et omnes parentes et amicos et benefactores atque familiares meos. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the body of Christ [Eucharistic prayer]
msItem.rubric: 51r Item alia oracio ad corpus Christi
msItem.incipit: 51r [P]rotege nos domine ihesu Christ per virtutem huius sacramenti corporis et sanguinis tui ab omnibus temptacionibus et potestate diaboli
msItem.explicit: 51v nobis concede percipe quatenus te miserante ad eternam beatitudinem valeamus peruenire. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to God
msItem.incipit: 51v [T]e adoro creatorem et te credo redemptorem . te ex peccato saluatorem. Sed tolle quod non posuisti et salua animam meam quod creasti. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to Christ's wounds
msItem.incipit: 51v-52r [V]ulnera tua domine mea sint medicamina. Mors tua. [J]hesu bone sit vita mea. Resurrectio tua. Sit saluacio et liberacio mea de omni malo et de omni impedimento corporis et anime et de omnibus angustijs et penis inferni et tormentis Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for deceased friends
msItem.incipit: 52r [A]doro et veneror hoc sanctissimum corpus et hunc sanguinem tuum et sanctissimo corpori tuo et sanguini tuo commendo animam famuli .N. et animas omnium fidelium defunctorum
msItem.explicit: 52r nobis miserrimis tuis post obitum cum eis in vitam eternam et requiem sempiternam concede per Christum dominum. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer for the dead
msItem.incipit: 52v [D]omine ihesu Christe clementissime pater miserere queso anime famuli tui .N. et animabus omnium fidelium defunctorum
msItem.explicit: 52v Et sanguinis tui quatenus ab omni vinculo delictorum absoluas in pacis ac lucis regione constituas et sanctuorum tuorum iubeas esse confortes per Christum Amen

msItem.title: Prayer before communion: Oratio ad accipiendum corpus domini et sanguinem [Oratio XXXIV]
msItem.author: Anselm of Canterbury
msItem.incipit: 52v [D]omine ihesu Christe qui [crossed out: 'pa'] patre disponente sancto spiritu cooperante per mortem tuam spontanea voluntate misericorditer a peccato et morte eterna mundum redemisti
msItem.explicit: 53v quatenus in resurrecione reformes corpus humilitatis mee cofiguratum corpori claritatis tue secundum promissionem apostoli tui et in te in eternum gaudeam de gloria tua. Qui cum patre et spiritu sancto viuis et regnas deus per omnia secula. Amen

msItem.title: Psalms and chants for different occasions
msItem.incipit: 53v [S]i quis fuerit in tribulacione dicat cum deuocione psalmum: [S]aluum me fac deus quoniam intrauerunt aquae
msItem.explicit: 54r [P]ro causa expedienda dicat sepcies ante crucem: [M]iserere mei deus quoniam in te confidit anima mea. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer after communion
msItem.incipit: 54v [E]cce ihesu benigne quod concupivi teneo
msItem.explicit: 54v [C]ruor ex latere domini mihi maneat ad salutem et proficiat ad remedium sempiternum.

msItem.title: Prayer after communion
msItem.rubric: 54v Oracio post percepcionem corporis et sanguinis
msItem.incipit: 54v [C]orpus tuum domine quod sumpsimus et calix
msItem.explicit: 55r Sed tua pietate prosit mihi ad tutamentum mentis et corporis. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: 55r [S]ancta dei genitrix virgo semper maria
msItem.explicit: 55r [V]irgo per tuum filium per patrem et peraclitum assis presens ad obitum meum que muni spiritum. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer before mass
msItem.rubric: 55r Oracio ante missam dicenda ante altare
msItem.incipit: 55r [I]n spiritu humilitatis et in animo contrito ante altare sanctum tuum domine ihesu Christe redemptor mundi accedimus
msItem.explicit: 56v laudemus nomen tuum quod est benedictum in secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer during mass
msItem.incipit: 56v [A]gimus tibi patri gratias pro iam beatificatis postulantes eorum interventu apud te adiuvari
msItem.explicit: 57r Qui tecum viuit et regnat in unitate spiritu sancti deus per omnia secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer before the altar
msItem.rubric: 57r [S]i volueris aliquid impetrare: hanc oracionem frquenter dic ante altari
msItem.incipit: 57r [A]donay domine deus magne et mirabiliter
msItem.explicit: 59v domine deus magne et mirabilis qui es iustus et misericors. Amen.

msItem.title: Oratio ad deum [Oratio IX]
msItem.author: Anselm of Canterbury
msItem.incipit: 59v [O]mnipotens deus et misericors pater et bone domine miserere mihi peccatori da mihi veniam peccatorum meorum
msItem.explicit: 60r-60v libera me ab omni malo et perduc me in vitam eternam. Amen

msItem.title: Oratio ad Christum cum mens vult eius amore fervere [Oratio XX]
msItem.author: Anselm of Canterbury
msItem.incipit: 61v [D]omine ihesu Christe redempcio mea misericordia mea salus me te laudo [crossed out: 'te'] et gracias ago
msItem.explicit: 61v Veniet in terra [sic: interea] fortasse redemptor meus quia bonus est nec tardabit. Quia pius est . Ipsi gloria in saecula saeculorum. Amen
msItem.note: For another copy of Oratio XX, see ff. 34v-38v.

msItem.title: Prayer to God
msItem.incipit: 61v [S]ancte sanctorum Spiritus qui in deum verum colimus
msItem.explicit: 62v Amor herilis serueat . vt semper et tibi domino famulemur cum gaudio. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for putting on clothes
msItem.rubric: 62v Oracio quando incipis vestire te vestes dic istam
msItem.incipit: 62v [P]rotector in te sperancium deus sine quo nichil est validum nichil sanctum
msItem.explicit: 62v [D]eus in nomine tuo et dicitur totus Psalmus. In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti. Amen

msItem.title: Blessing
msItem.incipit: 62v [B]enedicat me imperialis maiestas protegat me regalis diuinitas
msItem.explicit: 63r [O]mnipotens dominus sua gracia nos benedicat [M]eritis et precibus sue pijssime matris benedicat nos filius dei patris. Ille nos benedicat qui sine fine viuit et regnat deus. Per omnia saecula saeculorum. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for protection from the Four Evangelists
msItem.incipit: 63r [S]ignum saluatoris conseruet nos omnibus horis Matheus ab oriente adiuuet nos. Marcus a meridie custodiat nos. lucas ab occidente proteget nos. Johannes ab auilone conseruet nos
msItem.explicit: 63v Jhesu Christe nazarene iheus Christe crucifixe miserere mei et custodi me a peccato et ab omni malo

msItem.title: Prayer for washing
msItem.incipit: 63v [A]b omnibus sordibus et peccatis meis laua me domine qui es saluator et redemptor meus et ego tua creatura sum
msItem.explicit: 63v Munda me domine inquinamento mentis et corporis vt possim mundatus implere opus sanctum dei. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the Guardian angel
msItem.incipit: 64r [O]mni sancte angele . modo deus dedit tibi vt me defenderes et ad bonum me transheres tibi iniuris intuli
msItem.explicit: 64r [A]ngele qui meus es custos pietate superna. Me tibi comissum salua defende guberna. Angelis suis in mandauit de te vt custodiant te in omnibus vijs tuis. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for leaving a house
msItem.rubric: 64r Exiens de domo dic istos versus
msItem.incipit: 64r [V]ias tuas domine demonstra mihi et semitas tuas deoce me
msItem.explicit: 64v [A]b occultis meis munda me domine et ab alienis parce seruo tuo

msItem.title: Unspecified prayer
msItem.incipit: 64v [I]n viam pacis ac prosperitatis omnipotens et misericors deus
msItem.explicit: 64v vt in pace salute et prosperitate reuertar ad propria. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for entering a church
msItem.rubric: 65r Intrante te ecclesiam amoto capicio dic istam oracionem
msItem.incipit: 64v-65r [I]ntroibo in domini tuam domine adorabo ad templum sanctum tuum in timore tuo. Beati qui habitant in domino tua domine. In saecula saeculorum laudabunt te.

msItem.title: Unspecified prayer
msItem.incipit: 65r [O]mnipotens sempiterne deus; respice propicius ad preces meas et da mhi et da michi fidem rectam
msItem.explicit: 65r Qui cum deo patre et spiritu sancto viuis et regnas deus . per omnia secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.title: Prayers for entering the bedroom
msItem.rubric: 65v Cum volueris ire cubitum siue dormitum dic istam oracionem
msItem.incipit: 65v [I]n nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti amen
msItem.explicit: 67v representa nos quaesumus domine matutinis horis incolumes vt nos omni tempore habeas laudatores per dominum nostrum ihesum Christum etcaetera

msItem.title: Prayer for going to bed
msItem.incipit: 67v [M]e mundet et illuminet . consignet et saluet titulis triumphalis Jhesus Nazerenus rex iudeorum ffili dei et gloriose virginis marie miserere et tocius populi Christiani
msItem.explicit: 68r [V]espertine laudis officia persoluentes clemenciam tuam domine humili prece deposcimus vt nocturnas insidiatoris fraudes te protegente vincamus. Per Christum dominum

msItem.title: Prayer for the Elevation of the Host
msItem.incipit: 68r [A]ue corpus vere natum de maria virgine
msItem.explicit: 68v-69r O panis vine presta mihi gaudia vite. Morbos auerte. pestes preme. crimina dele. Per te mundetur. meus sensus purificetur.

msItem.title: Prayer after the Elevation of the Chalice
msItem.rubric: 69r Post elevacionem calicis dic istam oracionem
msItem.incipit: 69r [A]nima Christi sanctifica me
msItem.explicit: 69r In hora mortis voca me et pone iuxta te vt cum angelis tuis laudem te. In secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the body of Christ
msItem.incipit: 69v [D]omine ihesu Christe te suplex deprecor et humilis et in hac hora et in die exitus mei ex hac presenti vita sanctum corpus tuum et sanguinem tuum tibi placita deuocione et reuerencia fideliter percipere merear quod mihi sit dux et viaticum et lucerna lucens et illuminans animam meam ante conspectum misericordiae tuae. Oracio. vivit et regnat deus per omnia secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer on the Passion
msItem.incipit: 69v [D]omine ihesu Christe qui per gloriosam passionem et pijssimam mortem tuam redemisti mundum redime me et miserere mei
msItem.explicit: 70r [E]t anime omnium fidelium defunctorum per tuam pijssimam misericordiam in pace requiescant. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for the Elevation of the Chalice
msItem.incipit: 70r [A]ve sanguis Christi vere emans a latere dextro nostra peccata dilue et vitam nobis eternam tribue
msItem.explicit: 70r-70v Corpus et sanguinis domini nostri ihesu Christi perducati nos ad gaudia eterna paradisi. In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for after the Agnus Dei
msItem.incipit: 71r [A]gnus dei viui qui tollis peccata mundi qui pro nostra redempcione fuisit immolatus meritis
msItem.explicit: 71r Et per intercessionem sanctorum tuorum hic et in eternum miserere mei secundum magnam misericordiam tuam. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for after Mass
msItem.incipit: 71r [G]racias tibi ago domine sancte pater omnipotens eterne deus qui me peccatorem indignum faciare dignatus es corpore et sanguine filij tui domini nostri ihesu Christi
msItem.explicit: 71v Societas plena iocunditas perfecta et gaudium sempiternum. Amen Pater noster. Aue maria et Credo. In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer for leaving church
msItem.rubric: 71v In exeundo ecclesiam dicitur sequens deuocio flexis genibus coram altari
msItem.incipit: 71v [I]hesu fili Dauid miserere mei Qui plasmasti me miserere mei
msItem.explicit: 72r O bone ihesu. O magne ihesu. O pie ihesu exaudi me qui omnia traxisti ad te pendens in cruce miserere mihi peccatori. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to Christ
msItem.incipit: 72v [L]ibera me et salua me rex eterne glorie qui potes liberare et saluare da mihi miserimo peccatori velle et operari et perficere quae tibi placent et mihi expediunt
msItem.explicit: 72v De futuris dignare largiri custodiam. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to Christ
msItem.incipit: 72v [D]omine ihesu Christe qui hanc sacratissimam carnem tuam et preciosissimam sanguinem de gloriose semper virginis marie vtero assumpsisti
msItem.explicit: 73r In eadem carne libera me deus per hoc sacrosanctum corpus tuum quod modo tracatur in altari ab omnibus immundiciis mentis et corporis et ab vniuersis malis preteritis presentibus et futuribs. In nomine patris et filij et spiritus sancti. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to God
msItem.incipit: 73r [D]eus pijsime deus clemens et deus misericors propiciare peccatis nostris
msItem.explicit: 74v Tuo supplices auxilio erige nos domine et alleua in misericordia tua ut communione salutis et gaudio caritatis dum ipsi saluari ex munere tuo cupimus et fide et pace cuntarum gencium gaudeamus. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary [Obsecro te]
msItem.incipit: 74v [O]bsecro te domina sancta mater dei pietate plenissima summi regis filia
msItem.explicit: 76v Et exaudi me dulcissima maria mater dei misericordiae. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer against enemies
msItem.incipit: 77r [D]eus propicius esto mihi peccatori et custos mei [crossed out: 'ab'] omnibus diebus vite mee
msItem.explicit: 77v Crux Christi salu me + Crux Christi protege me + Crux Christi defende me. In nomine patris + et filij + et spiritus sancti + Amen

msItem.title: Prayer after Mass
msItem.rubric: 77v Post missam solet ista oracio dici
msItem.incipit: 77v-78r [P]rotector in te sperancium deus sine quo nichil est validum multiplica super nos misericordiam tuam ut te rectore te duce sic transeamus per bona temporalia vt non amittamus eterna. Per [sic]

msItem.title: Prayer for after Mass
msItem.incipit: 78r [D]eus qui admirabili prouidencia disponis te supplices exoramus ut terram quam unigenitus filius tuus proprio sanguine consecrauit de manibus inimicorum crucis Christi eripiens restituas cultui Christianorum vota fidelium ad eius liberacionem et instauracionem misericorditer dirigendo in viam pacis eterne. Per [sic]

msItem.title: Prayer for a bishop
msItem.incipit: 78r [R]ege quaesumus domine famulum tuum pontificem nostrum et intercedente beata dei genitrice tue in eo dona multiplica ut ab omnibus liber[etur] offensis et temporalibus non destituatur auxilijs. Per [sic ending]

msItem.title: Prayer before the Pax
msItem.incipit: 78v [D]omine ihesu Christe de celo veniens qui dixisti tuis. Pacem meam do vobis. pacem relinquo vobis; ne respicias peccata mea sed fidem ecclesie tue eamque secundum voluntatem tuam pacificare custodire adiuuare et regere digneris. Qui viuis et regnas deus. Per [sic ending]

msItem.title: Indulgenced prayer to the Virgin attributed to St Bernard
msItem.textLang: Middle English rubric with Latin prayer
msItem.rubric: 78v-79r Seynt Bernarde made þis oryson sewyng of þe compassyon of þe holy vyrgyn marye þe modyr of our lorde iesu crist þe wheche sche hadd in þe passyon of here sone and hoo so seyþ þis oryson in þe honour of þe compassyon of our gloryous lady schall haue all þe indulgences of all þe stacions of Rome þe wheche conteyne .CCC.M ȝeer. Also þe holy pope seynt Bonefas more ouer graunted to all þo þat beþ contryt and confessed and seye þis oryson as ofte as þey seye it a .Ml ȝeer of pardon. And also to all þo þat seye þis oryson euerye daye terme of lyf he graunteþ pleyne indulgences withouten endee. Oracio bona
msItem.incipit: 78v [S]tabat master dolorosa / Iuxta crucem lacrimosa
msItem.explicit: 80v Quando corpus morietur / ffac vt anime donetur / Paradisi gloria

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see McKitterick and Beadle (1992), p. 58

msItem.title: A Revelation of Six Psalms ['A Revelation Shown to a Yorkshire Woman']
msItem.textLang: Middle English rubric with Latin prayers
msItem.rubric: 80v-81v [A] Reuelacion þat was schewid to a reliyous woman of þe nonrye of hampull. The wheche had a broþer a squyer of ȝoork schyre. The wheche squer was woundyd to þe deþ at þe bateyll of Schrowysbery and alyue caryed hoom and in schort tyme after he dyed. And þan þis holy woman þis nonne prayed to god þat he wolde vouchesaf to schewe to hyre how yt stood with hyr broþer sowle [...] And þees salmes with þe orysons must be seyde an .C. syþys and fyftye. Psalmus [D]eus deus meus rescipe. Oracio sequens.
msItem.incipit: [D]omine ihesu Christe suscipe hos psalmos ad laudem et honorem sancti nominis tui
msItem.explicit: 82r [D]omine ihesu Christe per hoc honorem commendacionis qua patri tuo omnipotenti animam tuam commedasti pietatem tuam humiliter imploramus vt animas omnium benefactorum nostrorum per misericordiam dei in pace resquiecant
msItem.note: The set of six psalms is left unfinished after the second psalm and corresponding prayer.

msItem.title: Prayers to the Five Sorrows of the virgin Mary shown to St John the Evangelist in a vision
msItem.textLang: Middle English rubric with Latin prayers
msItem.rubric: 82v-84r [I]n þe book of seynt John þe holy apostle is wreten þat after þe tyme þat our lorde god ihesu crist had payed hys hert blood in raunson of all mankynde and had liftid vp his blyssyd modyr our lady seynt marye and maad hyr worþy queen of heuen thys holy apostle seynt ion desyred for to see þis gloryous ladye [...] Also forsoþe whoo so praye to þe in mynde of þe .v. he schall haue my grace and y schall ȝeue þe full power of hys bodye and of hys sowle for to do with hym what mercy þat þou wylt. And þees ben þe fyve orysons
msItem.incipit: 84r [R]egina clemencie deprecor te adorans ad moueo per dolorem et tribulacionem quas habuisti quando beatus Symeon tibi dixit
85v [I]n omni tribulacione et angusta succure nobis pijssima dei genitrix virgo semper maria

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 241

msItem.title: Prayer to Christ
msItem.incipit: 85v [I]nterueniat pro nobis quaesumus domine ihesu Christe nunc et in hore mortis nostre apud tuam clemenciam beata et gloriosa semper virgo maria mater tua cuius sanctissimam animam in hora passionis tue doloris gladius pertransivit. Qui cum deo patre et filio et spiritu sancto viuis et regnas deus per omnia secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: Verse prayer
msItem.incipit: 86r [P]ater filij et spiritus sancti tres persone / Deus unus ordinans cuncta ratione
msItem.explicit: 86v O princeps apostole petre deo care / Tibi posse contulit soluere et ligare / vt absoluar vicijs velis exorare / cum sanctis vt valeam collandare. Amen

msItem.title: Verse prayer
msItem.incipit: 86v Noli me relinquere Paule desolatum / Cum Saulus existeras elasti peccatum
msItem.explicit: 87v Quos praestet filius atque sacrum flamen / In celo me collocent cum beatis amen

msItem.title: Prayer to resolve a conflict or disagreement
msItem.rubric: 87v [S]i aliquis sit iratus contra te. Si vis concordari cum eo; dicas istam oracionem et sine dubio ipse tecum celerite concordatus erit. Oracio sequens
msItem.incipit: 87v [O]mnipotens dilectissime deus sanctissime atque amantissime pater obsecro te per unigenitum filium tuum in dominum nostrum iesum Christum
msItem.explicit: 88r vt nulla umquam oblivione deleatur sed perpetue misericordie seruetur. Per te ipsum dominum nostrum ihesum Christi tibi enim honor et potestas et imperium. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer on the titles of the Virgin Mary
msItem.rubric: 88r Hec sunt nomina beate marie et quicumque omni die sabato ea dixerit vel audierit cum humilitate et deuocione procul dubio cum beata virgine particeps erit et in obitu suo ei apperebit. Oracio sequens
msItem.incipit: 88r [O] domina . O virgo. O virga
msItem.explicit: 88v O casta. O adoratrix. O maria. Amen

msItem.title: Verse prayer to St Katherine
msItem.incipit: 89r [G]aude virgo katerina / Qua crescentes lux divina
msItem.explicit: 89r ffac vt tecum gaudeamus / In celesti culmine. Amen. Ora pro nobis beata Katerina etcaetera

msItem.title: Verse prayer on the Five Wound
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric with a Middle English prayer
msItem.incipit: 89v [I]hesu Christ of Nazareþ / That for vs all suffriddeþ / vppon þe rode tree / Thorow vertu of ȝowre woundes .v. / That ȝe suffryd in ȝoure lyue / Haue mercy on me. Amen.

msItem.title: Hymn to the Virgin Mary
msItem.textLang: Middle English prayer with a Latin rubric
msItem.incipit: 90r [H]eyle be þou ladye so bryȝt / Gabriel þat seyde so ryȝt
msItem.explicit: 90v Marye þu vs wysely wysse / Be daye and be nyȝt. Amen.

msItem.title: Verse prayer of confession
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric with Middle English prayer
msItem.incipit: 90v [S]wete ihesu crist to þe / Culpable wrecche y ȝelde me
msItem.explicit: 91v In to þat blyssffull empyre / There þat þu reygnest lorde syre. Amen.

msItem.title: Verse prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric with Middle English prayer
msItem.rubric: 91v Oracio bona de sancta maria sequens
msItem.incipit: 92r [S]wete ladye seynt marye / ffull of all curtesye
msItem.explicit: 92r And all cristen men / Swete ihesu cryst. Amen.

msItem.title: Verse prayer to Christ
msItem.author: Richard Caister [Caistor]
msItem.textLang: Middle English prayer with a Latin rubric
msItem.incipit: 92v [I]hesu lorde þat madyst me / And with þy blysfull blood hast bouȝt
msItem.explicit: 93v ffor þe wheche y haue had anye good / And spare þat þey han don amysse. Amen.

msItem.title: Verse prayer to the Virgin Mary from the Speculum Christiani (Octava Tabula)
msItem.textLang: Middle English prayer with a Latin rubric
msItem.rubric: 93v Oracio bona de sancta Maria sequens
msItem.incipit: 93v [M]arye modyr well þu be / Marye mayden þu þenke on me
msItem.explicit: 94v And þat he send me grace / In heuen to haue a place. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer on the Holy Name of Jesus
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric with Middle English prayer
msItem.incipit: 94v [O] Gode ihesu. O swete ihesu. O þe sone of marye full of mercy and pyte
msItem.explicit: 96r put in me grace wysdom and charyte þat y mary perfytly loue þe. Prese þee. vse þe. and serue þe. And ioye in þe all þat louen þi name þe wheche ys Jhesus. Amen.

listBibl.bibl: For other copies, see Connolly (2009), p. 242.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Trinity
msItem.incipit: 96r [O] beata et benedicta et gloriosa trinitas. Pater et filius et spiritus sanctus. tibi laus. tibi gloria. tibi graciarum.
msItem.explicit: 96v Sic peragere in tuo sancto seruicio cum humilitate et discrescione. mansuetudine. paciam. castitate cum ceteris bonis tuis qui tibi placent in veritate quatenus seruitus mea tibi placeat. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to Christ
msItem.incipit: 96v [D]omine ihesu Christe per vexillum sancte crucis te adoro
msItem.explicit: 96v et ad finem vite mee animam meam perducas in celestem paradisum vbi angeli et omnes sancti exultant sine fine. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Guardian Angel
msItem.incipit: 97r [A]ngele qui meus es custos pietate superna me tibi . salua defende guberna
msItem.explicit: 97r Versiculus: O beate angele misericordio domini altissimi Responsorium: Cognatus et actus meos regula ad votum dei altissimi

msItem.title: Prayer to God
msItem.incipit: 97r [D]eus qui sanctorum angelorum tuorum aliquos tibi benigne concedys assistere
msItem.explicit: 97r-97v Sic angelum mihi comissimum ad custodiam me in bonis dirigere et ad virtutes assidue excitare et a peccatorum voragine potentissime liberare quatenus in districto iudicio quando fiet vnum ouile omnium ac eciam angelorum sub tanto pastore merear inter sua pecora numerari. Per dominum nostrum ihesum Christum qui tecum vivit et regnat. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Holy Name
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric with Middle English prayer
msItem.incipit: 97v O gloryouse iesu. O swete iesu. O alþer swettyst iesu
msItem.explicit: 98r O. merciful ihesu after þy greet mercy haue mercy on me. O. blisful ihesu. O. ihesu preysed be þy name withouten ende. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric with Middle English prayer
msItem.incipit: 98r [O] quene of heuen. O. mary full of pite and of mercy haue mercy on me. O. glorious lady
msItem.explicit: 98v O lady. O floure of virgynyte. O quene of heuen after þi greet mercy haue mercy on me. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Guardian angel
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric with Middle English prayer
msItem.incipit: 98v [I] Praye þe spirit þat angell arte / To whom y am be take
msItem.explicit: 99v That my sowle came fro / Euer in ioye with angeles to synge. Amen.

msItem.title: Verse prayer to the Trinity
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric with Middle English prayer
msItem.rubric: 99v Oracio deuota de trinitate valde bona
msItem.incipit: 99v [A]lmyȝty god fadyr of heuen / ffor cristys loue þat dyed on rode
msItem.explicit: 100r lorde haue mercy on mee / And on all þat mercy nede for charite. Amen.

msItem.title: Quindecim Orationes [The Fifteen O's] intercalated with the Middle English poems "O Vernicle" and "I Thanke thee Lord"
msItem.textLang: Latin rubric followed by a sequence of Latin and Middle English prayers
msItem.rubric: 100v-103r [F]emina solitaria et reclusa numerum vulnerum Christi scire cupiens. Orauit dominum vt sibi reuelaret. Et dicit ei dominus. Corporis mei vulnera tot extiterunt que ve\ne/racione aliqua recolere volueris .x. Pater noster. et tot Aue maria. Dices cotidie per unum sicque reuoluto anno vnum quod que vulnus venerabiliter salutabis [...] Si vero fuerit in statu maximi purgatorij Deus mutabit hanc in penam hic corporalem et ipsum sine purgatorio ad eterna gaudia perducit. Incipit oracio hoc modo
msItem.incipit: 103r O vernacle I honour hym and þe / þat he made þorow his priuete
msItem.explicit: 113v et accepta ac finis vite mee ita laudabilis ut post huius vite terminum te merear laudare cum omnibus sanctis tuis in eternum. Amen. Pater noster. Aue maria.
msItem.note: The Fifteen O's intercalated with the Middle English verse poems "O Vernicle" [A meditiation on the instruments of the Passion] (ff. 111v-113r) and "I Thanke thee Lord" [A prayer of thanksgiving for the Redemption] (ff. 111v-113r).

listBibl.bibl: IMEV 2577 ["O Vernicle"]; IMEV 1370 ["I Thanke thee Lord"]
NIMEV 2577 ["O Vernicle"]; NIMEV 1370 ["I Thanke thee Lord"]
DIMEV 4083-5 ["O Vernicle"]; DIMEV 2290-2 ["I Thanke thee Lord"]
Louis (1980) [for other copies of the introductory rubric]

msItem.title: Prayer to Christ
msItem.incipit: 113v [G]racias tibi ago domine ihesu Christe quod passionem tuam inchoasti potenter
msItem.explicit: 114r vt sic protectus tibi semper assim in gaudijs animam meam protege \tua/ semper proteccione quam redemisti domine tuo sanguine. Amen.

msItem.title: Blessings
msItem.incipit: 114r-114v [S]ignum sancte + crucis defen[de] me a malis presentibus preteritis et futuris interioribus et exterioribus
msItem.explicit: 115v Crux mihi protectio et adiutorium in presenti vita et in futuro iudicio. Amen

msItem.title: The Eight Verses of St Bernard
msItem.rubric: 116r Inuenitur in libro Bernardi quod diabolus dixit ei . quod sciebat .viijo. versus psalterij quod qui diceret omni die saluabitur. et cum requisitus esset a beato Bernarduo qui essent uoluit eos sibi manifestare . Respondit beatus bernardus . quod cotidie totum psalterium diceret. Audiens hoc diabolus manifestauit sibi. Et sunt isti versus.
msItem.incipit: 116r [I]llumina oculus meos ne unquam obdormiam in morte
msItem.explicit: 116r [E]t numerum dierum meorum quis est; ut sciam quid desit mihi

msItem.title: Two daily verses
msItem.rubric: 116r Et istos duos versus precedentes quicumque cotidie dixerit. finis vite sue a domino sine dubio sibi reuelabitur
msItem.incipit: 116r [D]irupisti domine vincula mea tibi
msItem.explicit: 116v [F]ac mecum signum in bono ut videant qui oderunt me et confundantur; quoniam tu domine adiuuisti me et consolatus es me

msItem.title: Indulgenced prayer to Christ
msItem.rubric: 116v [D]ominus iohannes papa vicesimus secundus omnibus vere contritis et confessis qui in memoriam passionis ihesu Christi deuote dixerit hab oraciones tria milia annorum penitencialium et tria milia annorum venialium
msItem.incipit: 116v [D]irupisti domine vincula mea tibi
msItem.explicit: 117r Et ideo de tua pietate confisus per tuas pijssimas passiones te deprecor ut me famulum tuum .N. celesti auxilio custodias et in tua proteccione defendas. Qui cum patre et spiritu sancto vivit et regnat dominus per omnia secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: 'O bone Jesu'
msItem.incipit: 117r [O] bone ihesu duo in me agnosco naturam quam tu fecisti et peccatum quod ego adieci fateor domine
msItem.explicit: 118v [D]omine ihesu Christe fili dei viui pone passionem crucem mortem et misericordiam tuam inter animam meam et iudicium tuum Qui cum patre et [sic ending]

msItem.title: Five verses to the Virgin Mary with an exemplum about a beheaded priest
msItem.rubric: 118v [Q]uicumque istos versus quinque subscriptos in honore beate et intemerate uirginis marie deuote cotidie dixerit nonnunquam in confessus morietur ut probatum est per quendam clericus cuius caput amputabatur nec emisit spiritum quo ad usque plenissime fuisset confessus
msItem.incipit: 119r [M]ater digna dei: venie via luxque diei
msItem.explicit: 119r [Ch]riste fili dei: tu miserere mei

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.rubric: 119r [Q]uicumque istam subscriptam oracionem in honore beate marie deuote cotidie dixerit ipsam tribus diebus ante mortem suam procul dubio videbit
msItem.incipit: 119r [O] Maria pijssima stella maris clarissima mater misericordie et aula pudicie
msItem.explicit: 119v preposito michaeli archangelo cuius constat officio . a maligno diabolo . dignos quosque eripere et paradiso reddere. Amen.

msItem.title: Six Salutations to Christ purportedly indulgenced by Pope Boniface for King Philip of France
msItem.rubric: 119v [B]onifacius papa concessit duo millia annorum indulgencie dicenti istam oracionem cum sex .Aue. de eucaristia ad instanciam philippi regis francis. Oracio.
msItem.incipit: 119v [A]ue ihesu Christe uerbum patris virginis filius agnus dei saluus mundi hostia sacra verbum caro fons pietatis
msItem.explicit: 120r [A]ve ihesu Christe salus vita perhennis mundi verbum patris hostia vera uiua caro deitas integra vero homo flos et fructus virginitatis
msItem.note: The indulgence perhaps refers Philip IV (r. 1285–1314) whose reign coincides with the papacy of Boniface VIII (r. 1294–1303)

msItem.title: Prayer for the Elevation
msItem.rubric: 120r [H]ec sequens oracio dicitur inter eleuacioni corporis Christi et agnus dei. Oremus
msItem.incipit: 120r [D]omine ihesu Christe fili dei viui qui hanc sacratissimam carnem et preciosissimum sanguinem tuum de gloriose virginis vtero assumpsisti
msItem.explicit: 120v per hoc sacrosanctum corpus tuum quod modo in altari tractatur ab omnibus immundicijs mentis et corporis ab vniuersis malis periculis presentibus preteritis et futuris nunc et in euum. Amen.

msItem.title: Verse prayer to the Trinity
msItem.incipit: 120v [L]orde þat art of myȝtis moost / ffadir and sone and holygoost
msItem.explicit: 120v-121r In heuen blys þou ȝeue me grace / The to see face to face / Worlde with outen ende. Amen

msItem.title: Verse hymn to St John the Baptist
msItem.rubric: 121r Oracio deuota de Sancto Johanne baptista
msItem.incipit: 121r [O] Johannes gloriossime / O batista graciose / ffons origo sanctitatis / Virgo sancte castitatis
msItem.explicit: 124v Me et meos omni modo / In manus tuas commendo / ffiant in tuis meritis / Celi fruantur gaudijs / Praesens in peraclito / Qui cum patre et filio / Viuit et regnat vnus / Per cuncta secula deus. Amen. Versiculus: Ora pro nobis beate Johannes baptista. Responsorium: Vt digni efficiamur etcaetera.

msItem.title: Prayer to St John the Baptist
msItem.incipit: 125r [O]mnipotens sempiterne deus qui beatum iohannem baptistam martiremque venerabilem filij tui domnini nostri ihesu Christi
msItem.explicit: 125r concede quaesumus vt ea que pro nostra salute poscimus et optamus: eo intercedente apud tuam clemenciam misericorditer consequamur. Per Christum dominum nostrum. Amen.

msItem.title: Suffrage to St John the Baptist
msItem.rubric: 125r Alia oracio de sancto iohanne baptista
msItem.incipit: 125r [O] beatissime iohannes baptista precursor domini et martir Christi virgo ihesum Christum baptizare in iordanis flumine meruisti
msItem.explicit: 125v et ab omni opprobrio custodire et donet mihi quam domini subsisto in hijs fragilibus membris segregato a vicijs omnibus feliciter vultare et ad regna celestia peruenire. Qui viuit a regnat benedictus per in finita secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: Suffrage to St Malo
msItem.incipit: 125v Memoria sancti Melloni primi archiepiscopi Rothomagensis qui hanc vrbem intrauit. [A]ngelus domini tenens virgam pastorale tradidit eam sancto mellono dicens.
msItem.explicit: 126r Sancte Mellone ora pro nobis [I]mmensum pietatis tue clemenciam quaesumus diuina maiestas vt qui animam beati melloni confeffessoris [sic: confessoris] tui atque pontificis celebramus solennitatem [sic: solemnitatem] eius obtinentibus meritis perueniamus ad gaudia repromissa. Per Christum dominum nostrum. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to All Saints
msItem.incipit: 126r [S]uccurrite mihi queso omnes sancti dei ad quorum ego miserimus peccator patrocinia confugio succurite mihi antequam mors rapiat
msItem.explicit: 127r Adiutate omnes sancti et electi dei vt peruenire valeam ad vos. Prestante domino ihesu Christo qui trinitatis et vnus. viuit et regnat deus in secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: Hymn to the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: 127r [T]e matrem dei laudamus. Te Mariam virginem confitemur. Te eterni patris sponsam omnis terra vener\e/atur
msItem.explicit: 128r Tu angelorum domina . tu paradisi ianua. tu scala regnis celestis

msItem.title: Verse prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: 128v [A]ue mundi spes maria / Aue mitis aue pia
msItem.explicit: 129r vt resurgam te visurus / Semper tecum fini mansurus / Per in mortalia / Seculorum secula

msItem.title: Meditation on the Passion (according to John the Evangelist)
msItem.rubric: 129v Si quis dixerit cotidie istam passionem sequentem .s. sancti Bernardi diuina expiracione factam et constitutam; superabit omnes malignos spiritus et eorum temptaciones
msItem.incipit: 129v [P]assio domini nostri ihesu Christi secundum Johannem in illo tempore; apprehendit pilatus ihesum et flagellauit eum
msItem.explicit: 130r Et qui ista vidit; testimonium peribuit. Et scimus quia verum est testimonium eius.

msItem.title: Prayer on the Passion
msItem.incipit: 130r [D]eus qui manus tuas et pedes tuos et totum corpus tuum pro nobis peccatoribus in ligno crucis posuisti
msItem.explicit: 130v et nos de sancto sanguine tuo redemisti nobis vsum penitencie abstinencie paciem lumen sensum et intellectum veram scientiam atque perseueranciam bonam vsque in finem per te ihesu Christe saluator mundi. Qui cum deo patre et spiritu sancto viuit et regnat deus per omnia secula seculorum. Amen

msItem.title: Indulgence for devotion to the Passion after the canonical hours attributed to Pope John XXII (r. 1244–1334)
msItem.incipit: 130v [C]ommemoraciones dominice passionis facte a domino papa Johanne .xxijo. dicende post horas canonicas. Et quicumque eas dixerit habebit pro qualibet hora .C. dies indulgencie ab eodem domino papa concessas. Patris sapientiaam etcaetera.

msItem.title: Prayer for after the collect of purity in Mass
msItem.incipit: 131r [D]eus qui de indignis dignos facis. de peccatoris iustos. de immundiis mundos
msItem.explicit: 131r Qui tecum viuit et regnat in vnitate eiusdem. Tunc dicitur adiutorium et sit nomen

msItem.title: Letter of Pope Leo to Charlemagne
msItem.rubric: 131v [D]ominus leo papa Rome has litteras scripsit Karolo magno Regi qui istas litteras habuerit super se scriptos inimicus nec gladius nec vlla passio nec serpens nec pocio mala ei nocebit
msItem.incipit: 131v h.d.q.f.p.s.f.c.a.q.c.a.g.e..h.n.d.m.nn.e.n.p.k.

msItem.title: Prayer of confession
msItem.incipit: 131v [C]onfiteor tibi pater celi et tere tibique ihesu bone et benignissime vnacum sancto spiritu coram beata et gloriosa semperque virgine maria
msItem.explicit: 133v sed sit gaudium in celis de me sicut promisisti esse super vno peccatore penitenciam agente te ipso largiente domino nostro ihesu Christo. Qui cum patre et spiritu sancto viuis et regnas deus. Per omnia secula seculorum

msItem.title: Suffrage to St Christopher
msItem.incipit: 134r [M]artir Christofore pro saluatoris honore ffac nos mente fore dignos deitate amore
msItem.explicit: 134r [C]oncede quaesumus omnipotens et misericors deus vt qui beati Christofori martiris tuis memoriam agimus eius meritis et intercessionibus a morte subitanea peste fame paupertate timore et ab omnibus inimicorum nostrorum liberemur per te ihesu Chrste quem ipse meruit in brachijs suis portare Qui cum patre et spiritu sancto viuis et regnas deus. Per omnia secula seculorum. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Trinity
msItem.incipit: 134v [D]omine deus omnipotens qui semper es trinitatis et vnus et eras ante omnia et eris semper in omnibus deus benedictus in secula
msItem.explicit: 137v mihi perpetuus defensor aduersus insidas hostis antiqui et societate angelorum omniumque sanctorum in sancto paradiso me perseuerare facias Qui tu es benedictus in secula seculorum
msItem.note: This prayer also occurs in the Libellus meditationum that was spuriously attributed to St Augustine (see n.a., 'Libellus meditationum', Mediaeval Studies, 52 (1990), 24-81).

msItem.title: Suffrage to St Barbara
msItem.incipit: 137v [A]ve virgo saluatoris / Deo laudem dans honoris
msItem.explicit: 138v [M]itissime deus misericordie et graciosissime indulgencie qui mortem non desideras peccatorum sed vitam adesto propicius supplicacionibus nostris et concede vt qui commemoracionem beatissime virginis et martiris tue barbare humili deuocione recolimus eius meritis suffragantibus ab ictibus mangnalium et ab omni periculo corporis et anime interius et exterius quamdiu vixerimus liberemur et post hanc miserabilem uitam cum ipsa iocundari mereamur in celis. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to All Saints
msItem.incipit: 138v-139r [O]mnipotens et misericors deus qui proprio filio tuo vt mundum saluaret non pepercisti precibus et meritis gloriose marie et beatorum apostolorum tuorum petri et pauli et beatorum martirum petri et pauli
msItem.explicit: 139r eorum meritis et interuentu misericors deus indulge animum ad penitenciam compunge cor contritum ne despicias die noctu quod me custodias et sic in seculo me gubernes. Vt cum eis ad eterna gaudia valeam peruenire

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: 139v-140r [O] mater marie misericordie domina mea clementissima virgo maria mater domini mei ihesu Christi
msItem.explicit: 139v-140r Obsecro te per dulcissimam dileccionem qua diligis vnicum filium tuum . vt erutum ab eterna morte transferas me ad gaudia vite eterne. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.rubric: 140r Alia oracio deuota de sancta maria
msItem.incipit: 140r Ave maria gracia plena quia ex plenitudine gracie tue mundo salus advenit
msItem.explicit: 140v Ave maria gracia plena dominus tecum benedicta tu in mulieribus et benedictus fructus ventris tui ihesus. Amen.

msItem.title: Prayer to God
msItem.incipit: 141r [D]eus omnnium dulcedo cordium animarum fons pietatis et pater misericordiarum de cuius numere
msItem.explicit: 143r et succurite mihi in angustijs mortis ut a terrore malignorum spirituum et a potestate diaboli et a morte perpetua valeam liberari et in loco refrigerij lucis et quietis cum sanctorum spiritibus gloriam vltime resurrexionis feliciter expectare. Amen

support.material: Parchment (FHHF, except Quire 4, which opens HFFH)

signatures.p: Leaf signatures consisting of Arabic numbers and letters ('a'-'t') in black or red ink on the lower right corners of the rectos of the first halves of quires.

catchwords.seg: Catchwords in black or red ink in the right lower corners of the last versos of quires.

collation.note: This collation deviates from the collations by H.L. Pink and M.R. James (unpublished descriptions) who consider quire 4 a quinternion with one leaf (the 10th leaf, according to Pink) cancelled. However, the fact that quire 4's second leaf features the signature 1d, suggests that the quire is a quaternion with an added leaf at the beginning.

p.seg: Ruled in ink, frame and line ruling. Single columns. 21 lines to the page, written below top line.

handNote.p: This description of hands is based on Towl (2011).
ff. 1r-30v have been copied by a single scribe working in a rounded Anglicana script.
ff. 30r-33v have been copied by a single scribe working in a rounded Anglicana script.
ff. 33r-39r have been copied by a single scribe working in a Bastard Secretary script.
ff. 39r-80v have been copied by a single scribe working in a Bastard Anglicana script.
ff. 80v-97r have been copied by a single scribe working in an Anglicana script.
ff. 97v-98r have been copied by a single scribe working in an Anglicana formata script.
ff. 98v-143r have been copied by a single scribe working in an Anglicana script.

decoNote.p: Rubrics in red throughout the manuscript.
Guide letters for 2-line initials (either planned or in the exemplar) in black or red ink throughout the manuscript.

origin.origDate: Copied in the 15th century (see Connolly (2009)), perhaps c. 1425 (see Nichols (2014)).

provenance.p: Unidentified ?merchant's mark in the inner margin of 32v.

msIdentifier.idno: Cambridge, University Library, MS Ii.6.43, ff. 146r-160r

msItem.title: Verse prayer to the Cross
msItem.incipit: 146r O gloryous crosse that with holy blode of chryst Jhesu haliwed was by grace O glorivs cros so myght and so good that all vartu by hevenly power has honoryd be the lo this day in euery place in hym worshipyng whom Jewes crucyfyed with nayles iij and for vs vpon a tree dyed
msItem.note: Full transcription; a previously unidentified copy of the first stanza from a verse litany of sixteen stanzas to the Cross, God the Father, the Trinity, the Virgin Mary, angels, apostles, and saints. Until now, 12 copies of this text have been identified.

msItem.title: Verse prayer to God the Father
msItem.incipit: 146r Moost blessyd father and almyghty lord maker of heven and creer of cretures of thy grace any prayers here accorde, whiche I preserve vnto thy mercyfull cures, thy gret power lord whiche [e]ver [e]ndures me defend from all synne and blame preserve and kepe by vartu of thy name
msItem.note: Full transcription; a previously unidentified copy of the second stanza from a verse litany of sixteen stanzas to the Cross, God the Father, the Trinity, the Virgin Mary, angels, apostles, and saints. Until now, 12 copies of this text have been identified.

msItem.title: Letter of Pope Leo to Charlemagne
msItem.incipit: 147r Hec est epistola domini salvatoris quam leo papa trasnmisit [sic: transmisit] karolo regi dicens qui dumque dam [sic: eam] portaverit secum in die qua eam viderit vell legit fero non occidetur nec igne comburetus nec malus homo nec diabolus nec aliqua alia creatura et nocere poterit
msItem.explicit: 147v Crux Cristi super me ante me et post me cruci antiquis hostis vbi te indett [sic]

msItem.title: Letter to King Abgar
msItem.author: Pseudo-Jesus Christ
msItem.incipit: 147v In nomine trino divino dei treli [sic: celi] incepit [sic: incipit] epistola domini nostri iesu Christi quam propria manew scripsit et misit abagare regi
msItem.explicit: 148v hanc epistolam vell super scriptam habuerit non gladio non igne non aqua non posione malit veneno non tonitruo non subitania morte perebit amen. ffinis.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: 149r Mater dingna [sic: digna] die venie via luxque diei sis tutela rei dux que comes et mei nata dei meresere [sic: miserere] mei lux alma dei digna celi regena poli me relinquere noli me tua virgo pia g[e]nitrix comendo maria fili Christe dei tu meserere mei amen. ffinis. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to God
msItem.incipit: Domine deus patrum nosterum [sic: nostrorum] benedicant te celi et terra mare et fontes et flumina et omnes creature tue qui in eis sont [sic: sunt]
msItem.explicit: 150r vt cognoscat vniversis gentium quia tu es deus [? feliis] in vniuersa tarra [sic: terra] qui dis [sic] benedictus. In secula seculorum amen. finis

msItem.title: Prayer for forgiveness of sins
msItem.incipit: 150v Respice ad me infelicem piata inmensa respice ad me crudelissimam miam publika despectus ad omnipotentem venie [sic: venio] vulnecatum [sic: vulneratum] ad medicum curro. Sarva [sic: Serva] pietatem mansuetudinem qui tamdiu suspen[d]isti gladium ulcionis. Dele numerositatem crimivm [sic: criminum] multitudinem mesericordiarum amen. ffinis - Amen

msItem.title: Ten medical recipes
msItem.note: Added by a later cursive hand, writing recipes upside down in relation to the manuscript's other contents

msItem.title: Entry on a birth
msItem.incipit: 159r Joen R[...] was borne the xxix daye of august 1519 at iij a cloke at after [noyn] of sondaye a [?menure] of seynt John Baptiste

p.seg: Occasionally ruled in crayon, frame and line ruling, but it is not possible to determine whether the text is written above or below the top line. Single columns. 16-29 lines to the page.

handNote.p: This description of hands is based on Towl (2011).
ff. 146r, 157v-154r have been copied by one hand in a neat Secretary script.
ff. 47r-150v have been copied by one hand in a very cursive Secretary script.

decoDesc.p: This part of the manuscript does not contain any significant form of decoration.

note.p: There are number sequences and calculations on ff. 151r-152r for determining costs as indicated by the use of the abbreviations 'li' and 's'. These numbers were added by a late 15th- or early 16th-century hand.

origin.origDate: Copied in the 4th quarter of the 15th or the 1st half of the 16th century.

provenance.p: Birth entry on f. 159r likely pertains to a family member of the owner. Unfortunately their surname is not legible.

change.persName: Dr Clarck Drieshen, Project Cataloguer, Cambridge University Library
